intro: Tarenna supra-axillaris subsp. barbertonensis, commonly known as the Barberton tarenna, is a small shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in terminal umbels. Its fruits are small, dry berries that contain one or two seeds. This species is often found in rocky or sandy soils in woodland and savanna habitats.
